subtitle: Tell your healthcare provider
title: Who shall I tell?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Some women want to keep their pregnancy a secret at first. 

But telling a healthcare provider does not mean you have to tell everyone else. 

Talking about being pregnant with a healthcare provider will be good for you and your baby. It will mean fewer problems if you get the right care early on.

 You can have tests to make sure that you and your baby are healthy. You can have blood and urine tests, and tests for HIV. If the test for HIV is not offered, don’t be afraid to ask for one.

Even if you feel well, get regular checkups so that you and your baby can stay healthy.
